column1: Lou Malnati's Pizzeria////Having only tried Giordano's and Gino's East from our previous trip to Chicago several years ago
column2: I can't really comment on how the deep dish pizza at Lou Malnati's compares to the other two.  I thought the pizza was decent and definitely filling.  I do remember the buttery crust being extra special compared to the other two popular joints.  I'm am only giving the place three stars partly because of the service.  I felt that it was a little disorganized since we were asked to switch tables initially.  Also
column3: we felt that the server could've been more attentive and followed up on how our pizza was or if we needed anything else.  Perhaps I was expecting too much going in that the experience was a little underwhelming.
